page.title: 12Transport in the Horton area
page.content: Horton is quite well served for transport.There are two bus services. These are the 323 and 329,Bristol to Hawkesbury Upton,with two buses in each direction per day.There are two bus stops in the village.Most of the people who live in the Horton area think that the bus service is quite good.Not many people travel by bus, however- most households have one or more cars and people are much more likely to make journeys by car rather than by bus.Some of the residents of Horton who we interviewed said that the village was suffering from too much traffic.We found that this was not the case.In one hour the only traffic to pass was- 46 cars,5 cycles 2 buses,10 goods lorries,5 tractors, and 3 vans.Little Sodbury is an even quieter village.
